content.user_title: Create seeded algorithmic art with p5.js
content.value_statement: You need original generative art that is reproducible and easy to explore. This skill guides you to craft an algorithmic philosophy and a seeded p5.js viewer with adjustable parameters.
actual_capabilities: Provides `templates/viewer.html` with a sidebar layout, seed controls, and a canvas container.
Loads p5.js and Google Fonts from CDNs in the HTML template.
Includes parameter sliders and color pickers wired to update handlers in the template.
Supplies a `templates/generator_template.js` guide with seeded randomness helpers and utility functions.
Defines reset and seed navigation functions in the HTML template for reproducible variations.
limitations: Requires internet access to load p5.js and fonts from CDNs.
Does not generate finished art by itself; you must implement the algorithm.
Outputs are single HTML artifacts, not hosted pages or deployments.
Very high particle counts can reduce browser performance.

use_cases.title: Prototype new systems
use_cases.description: Build a seeded p5.js sketch with tunable parameters for rapid generative experiments.

use_cases.title: Teach generative logic
use_cases.description: Demonstrate how algorithmic philosophy maps to parameters and emergent behavior in a live viewer.

use_cases.title: Explore visual directions
use_cases.description: Share interactive art variations with a single self contained HTML file.

prompt_templates.title: Starter sketch
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a simple first artwork
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a short algorithmic philosophy for a calm flow field and list three parameters with ranges for a seeded p5.js viewer.

prompt_templates.title: Particle trails
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a philosophy for drifting particles in a vector field and define parameters for count, speed, trail length, and noise scale.

prompt_templates.title: Subtle concept seed
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the concept of coastal fog as a subtle seed and propose a p5.js system with seeded randomness and gentle parameter controls.

prompt_templates.title: Layered dynamics
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a high craft philosophy for dual interacting fields and specify parameters, color controls, and a regeneration plan for the viewer.

output_examples.input: Create a philosophy and plan for seeded flow fields with adjustable density.
output: Movement name and four paragraph philosophy grounded in seeded emergence
Parameter plan listing density, speed, and noise scale with ranges
Viewer outline with seed navigation, sliders, and optional color pickers

best_practices: Use seeded randomness and noise for reproducible results.
Keep tunable parameters in one object to support reset and UI updates.
Regenerate the system when parameters change significantly.
anti_patterns: Copying a specific artist style or protected work.
Removing seed controls that enable reproducibility.
Setting particle counts so high that the browser freezes.

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Any modern browser that can load standard HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with p5.js.

faq.question: Are there output limits?
faq.answer: Outputs are guidance and templates, not pre rendered images or hosted files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my app?
faq.answer: Yes. Embed the single HTML viewer and the inline p5.js code in your project.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The templates do not include data storage or external transmission.

faq.question: What if the sketch runs slowly?
faq.answer: Reduce particle counts, simplify calculations, or lower canvas size.

faq.question: How does it compare to static art tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on procedural systems with reproducible variation, not manual image editing.
